title: Mouse Macros & League
body:
So after some brief research, League is fine with mouse macros...

What are some good things to macro?
I've got Lee Sin's ward jump on my list but nothing else really, Jarvan's EQ maybe?

replies.body:
What source did you get that info from? 

Text macros for chat won't get you banned, but using macros to gain a competitive advantage (e.g. executing combos faster) is not allowed. **Riot dArtagnan** talks about that [here](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/OvYEokpp-are-macros-considered-cheating?comment=0002).
What about macros for the joke/taunt/dance/laugh/special interaction/champ mastery?

Here's a great tip, if your hitting a button, and it's doing more than one button press, reconsider how necessary that is.

I've played plenty of online games, and the line tends to be "if one press of a button gives you more than one button press, that is disallowed."

Putting the button in a different spot is ok, but generally speaking any sort of combination/spamming stuff is stuff that gets you in shit.

But you can also use chat to proc emotes.

Soo...

question still stands

I guess my real question is, If I macro the emotes (spec. interaction and champ mastery included) to a mouse button, do I have to put them as 

> enter
> /joke
>enter

Or can I just macro

>Ctrl 1


Seeing as chat macros are okay, but key buttons aren't?

Macro's for emotes are fine, though personally I'd macro the text just to be safe. Binding say 2 to your mouse for items is fine as well (cause it's only one press).

Really it's anything that you're supposed to be doing yourself that the macro is doing for you in terms of gameplay, e.g Lee ward jump that is no bueno.

Say you want to have a macro that puts your 1 slot item on your middle click, I honestly don't see why you can't put a secondary binding to your middle mouse for item 1 instead of macroing and risking, the only way you can macro without getting bans is in chat, even that isn't 100% safe

That is fine, as long as your not binding buttons to do multiple presses (Like say for Lee having 4>W go from one button) your able to do it.
i dont see the point in cheating why cheat ? what are oyu really proving ?

Yeh pretty much what you are stating is a big no. You have a Ward>Dash set as a macro for Lee, that means you can click one spot and you will automatically ward and jump to it, what about those who can't macro? This gives you an advantage and is unfair.

Not like Riot can catch you anyway, I mean, all they can see is that you used two buttons simultaneously.
You aren't supposed to macro things like lee's ward jump, while it's not specifically fully against the rules, it's not something you should do.
Also I'm generally a friendly player so no I'm not gonna macro things like "-Enter- REKT -Enter"
